title: Aasimar
excerpt: Aasimar are mortals infused with celestial power, bearing the divine spark of the Upper Planes. They possess transformative revelations that manifest their celestial nature.

subEntries.title: Fallen Aasimar
subEntries.excerpt: Fallen aasimar are those touched by dark powers as a youth or who have turned to evil in early adulthood.

subEntries.title: Protector Aasimar
subEntries.excerpt: Protector aasimar are charged by the powers of good to guard the weak, strike at evil wherever it arises, and stand vigilant against the da…

subEntries.title: Scourge Aasimar
subEntries.excerpt: Scourge aasimar are imbued with a divine energy that blazes intensely within them.

title: Beastfolk
excerpt: Beastfolk are humanoids with animalistic features, ranging from avian to reptilian to mammalian traits. Each possesses unique abilities tied to their animal nature.

subEntries.title: Aarakocra
subEntries.excerpt: A winged people originating from the Elemental Plane of Air, aarakocra soar through the sky with grace.

subEntries.title: Giff
subEntries.excerpt: Giff are hippo-headed humanoids of impressive size who are renowned across the multiverse for their martial prowess and their love of firea…

subEntries.title: Hadozee
subEntries.excerpt: Hadozee are simian humanoids with wing-like flaps of skin that extend from their arms to their legs, allowing them to glide through the air.

subEntries.title: Harengon
subEntries.excerpt: Harengon are rabbit-folk native to the Feywild, though many have migrated to other planes.

subEntries.title: Kenku
subEntries.excerpt: Kenku are feathered folk whose roots trace back to the shadow of the raven.

subEntries.title: Leonin
subEntries.excerpt: Leonin are fierce, lion-like humanoids who dwell in the golden savannas of Theros.

subEntries.title: Lizardfolk
subEntries.excerpt: Lizardfolk are ancient reptilian humanoids who primarily inhabit swamps and jungles.

subEntries.title: Loxodon
subEntries.excerpt: Loxodon are elephant-like humanoids native to the plane of Ravnica, where they are known for their calm demeanor, strong sense of community…

subEntries.title: Minotaur
subEntries.excerpt: Minotaur are powerful, bull-headed humanoids known for their immense strength and martial prowess.

subEntries.title: Tabaxi
subEntries.excerpt: Curious and agile catlike humanoids, tabaxi are driven by a desire to uncover secrets and collect stories.

subEntries.title: Thri-kreen
subEntries.excerpt: Thri-kreen are insectoid humanoids who originated on the deserts of the world Athas but can be found in Wildspace and the Astral Plane.

subEntries.title: Tortle
subEntries.excerpt: Tortles are turtle-like humanoids who lead a simple and often nomadic life.

subEntries.title: Yuan-Ti
subEntries.excerpt: Yuan-ti are people who possess serpentine features, ranging from scales and slitted pupils to more drastic snakelike traits.

title: Constructed
excerpt: Constructed beings are sentient creatures built rather than born. Whether forged for war or crafted by gnomish ingenuity, they possess mechanical bodies animated by magic or the spark of life.

subEntries.title: Autognome
subEntries.excerpt: Autognomes are mechanical beings built by rock gnomes in their image, usually with a specific purpose in mind.

subEntries.title: Warforged
subEntries.excerpt: Warforged are living constructs created during the Last War of Eberron to serve as soldiers.

title: Draconic Kin
excerpt: Draconic Kin are humanoids touched by dragon blood. From the proud dragonborn to the cunning kobolds, they share a connection to dragonkind that grants them breath weapons, elemental resistance, or draconic cunning.

subEntries.title: Black Dragonborn
subEntries.excerpt: Descended from the cruel and predatory black dragons of the swamps, these dragonborn carry the power of acid in their breath.

subEntries.title: Blue Dragonborn
subEntries.excerpt: Descended from the regal and manipulative blue dragons of the deserts, these dragonborn command the power of lightning.

subEntries.title: Brass Dragonborn
subEntries.excerpt: Descended from the gregarious and talkative brass dragons of the hot deserts, these dragonborn command the power of fire.

subEntries.title: Bronze Dragonborn
subEntries.excerpt: Descended from the inquisitive and protective bronze dragons of the coastal caves, these dragonborn command the power of lightning.

subEntries.title: Copper Dragonborn
subEntries.excerpt: Descended from the witty and prankish copper dragons of the rocky hills, these dragonborn command the power of acid.

subEntries.title: Draconblood Dragonborn
subEntries.excerpt: Draconblood dragonborn are the product of selective breeding by the draconic sorcerers of ancient Draconia in the world of Exandria.

subEntries.title: Gold Dragonborn
subEntries.excerpt: Descended from the noble and wise gold dragons of the sun-drenched peaks, these dragonborn command the power of fire.

subEntries.title: Green Dragonborn
subEntries.excerpt: Descended from the cunning and deceptive green dragons of the dense forests, these dragonborn command the power of poison.

subEntries.title: Kobold
subEntries.excerpt: Small and clever, kobolds are distant kin of dragons.

subEntries.title: Ravenite Dragonborn
subEntries.excerpt: Ravenite dragonborn were once enslaved by the draconblood aristocracy but rose up to destroy the nation of Draconia.

subEntries.title: Red Dragonborn
subEntries.excerpt: Descended from the arrogant and covetous red dragons of the mountain peaks, these dragonborn command the power of fire.

subEntries.title: Silver Dragonborn
subEntries.excerpt: Descended from the friendly and altruistic silver dragons of the cloud-veiled peaks, these dragonborn command the power of cold.

subEntries.title: White Dragonborn
subEntries.excerpt: Descended from the feral and bestial white dragons of the ice-capped mountains, these dragonborn command the power of cold.

title: Dwarf
excerpt: Dwarves are stout, resilient folk known for their craftsmanship, endurance, and deep connection to stone and earth. They excel as warriors, smiths, and artisans.

subEntries.title: Duergar
subEntries.excerpt: Duergar are dwarves whose ancestors were transformed by centuries living in the deepest places of the Underdark.

subEntries.title: Hill Dwarf
subEntries.excerpt: Hill dwarves possess keen senses, deep intuition, and remarkable resilience.

subEntries.title: Mountain Dwarf
subEntries.excerpt: Mountain dwarves are strong and hardy, accustomed to a difficult life in rugged terrain.

subEntries.title: Runeward Dwarf
subEntries.excerpt: The Mark of Warding grants power over protection and security.

title: Eladrin
excerpt: Eladrin are elves native to the Feywild who embody the seasons. Their emotions and abilities shift with the seasons, from joyful spring to melancholy winter.

subEntries.title: Autumn Eladrin
subEntries.excerpt: When an eladrin is in the autumn season, they embody peace and goodwill, sharing freely with others and spreading kindness wherever they go.

subEntries.title: Spring Eladrin
subEntries.excerpt: When an eladrin is in the spring season, they are filled with unbridled joy and hope, overflowing with energy and enthusiasm.

subEntries.title: Summer Eladrin
subEntries.excerpt: When an eladrin is in the summer season, they burn with aggressive energy and fierce determination.

subEntries.title: Winter Eladrin
subEntries.excerpt: When an eladrin is in the winter season, they reflect sorrow and melancholy, withdrawing into contemplation and introspection.

title: Elf
excerpt: Elves are magical people of otherworldly grace, known for their keen senses, connection to the Feywild, and mastery of magic and nature. Each elven lineage reflects different aspects of elven culture.

subEntries.title: Astral Elf
subEntries.excerpt: Long ago, groups of elves ventured from the Feywild to the Astral Plane to be closer to their gods.

subEntries.title: Drow Lineage
subEntries.excerpt: Descended from elves who were once drawn into the Underdark, drow possess superior darkvision and unique innate magic.

subEntries.title: High Elf Lineage
subEntries.excerpt: Heirs to elves infused with the magic of the Feywild, high elves are naturally adept at arcane arts.

subEntries.title: Pallid Elf
subEntries.excerpt: Pallid elves are a subrace of elves unique to Exandria, dwelling in the shadowed recesses of the Pallid Grove in the Greying Wildlands.

subEntries.title: Sea Elf
subEntries.excerpt: Sea elves fell in love with the wild beauty of the ocean in the earliest days of the multiverse.

subEntries.title: Shadar-kai
subEntries.excerpt: Shadar-kai are the elves of the Shadowfell, a bleak and haunted realm where emotion itself feels muted.

subEntries.title: Shadowveil Elf
subEntries.excerpt: The Mark of Shadow grants power over illusion and darkness.

subEntries.title: Wood Elf Lineage
subEntries.excerpt: Embodying the spirit of primeval forests, wood elves are swift, perceptive, and have a primal connection to nature.

title: Feyfolk
excerpt: Feyfolk are creatures with deep ties to the Feywild or fey nature. From tiny fairies to towering firbolgs, they share an innate connection to wild magic and the natural world.

subEntries.title: Centaur
subEntries.excerpt: Centaurs hail from the Feywild, mystically resonating with the natural world.

subEntries.title: Fairy
subEntries.excerpt: Fairies are a wee folk from the Feywild, infused with its primal magic.

subEntries.title: Firbolg
subEntries.excerpt: Firbolgs are distant cousins of giants who trace their origins to the primeval forests of the multiverse.

subEntries.title: Satyr
subEntries.excerpt: Satyrs are fey beings who embody the revelry and wild spirit of the Feywild.

title: Genasi
excerpt: Genasi trace their ancestry to the genies of the Elemental Planes. Each genasi manifests the power of their elemental heritage through innate magic and resistance.

subEntries.title: Air Genasi Lineage
subEntries.excerpt: Air genasi are descended from djinn, the genies of the Elemental Plane of Air.

subEntries.title: Earth Genasi Lineage
subEntries.excerpt: Earth genasi trace their ancestry to dao, the genies of the Elemental Plane of Earth.

subEntries.title: Fire Genasi Lineage
subEntries.excerpt: Descended from efreet, the genies of the Elemental Plane of Fire, fire genasi channel the flamboyant and often destructive nature of flame.

subEntries.title: Water Genasi Lineage
subEntries.excerpt: Water genasi descend from marids, aquatic genies from the Elemental Plane of Water.

title: Gith
excerpt: The gith are psionic peoples who escaped mind flayer enslavement millennia ago. Now split into two cultures—the warlike githyanki and the contemplative githzerai.

subEntries.title: Githyanki
subEntries.excerpt: Hailing from the Astral Plane, githyanki are psionic warriors who escaped eons of servitude to mind flayers.

subEntries.title: Githzerai
subEntries.excerpt: Githzerai are disciplined dwellers of the Everchanging Chaos of Limbo.

title: Gnome
excerpt: Gnomes are magical folk known for their cleverness, curiosity, and mastery of illusion magic. Each gnome subrace reflects different aspects of gnomish ingenuity.

subEntries.title: Deep Gnome (Svirfneblin)
subEntries.excerpt: Deep gnomes, or svirfneblin, are natives of the Underdark.

subEntries.title: Forest Gnome Lineage
subEntries.excerpt: Forest gnomes possess a natural gift for illusion and an inherent quickness.

subEntries.title: Rock Gnome Lineage
subEntries.excerpt: Rock gnomes are the most common type of gnome, celebrated for their inventiveness and hardiness.

subEntries.title: Wordweaver Gnome
subEntries.excerpt: The Mark of Scribing grants power over written and spoken communication.

title: Goliath
excerpt: Goliaths are towering humanoids descended from giants, inheriting supernatural strength and resilience. Each goliath embodies the legacy of their giant ancestor.

subEntries.title: Cloud Giant Ancestry
subEntries.excerpt: As a goliath with Cloud Giant ancestry, you possess the grace and magic of the sky-dwellers.

subEntries.title: Fire Giant Ancestry
subEntries.excerpt: As a goliath with Fire Giant ancestry, you possess the common traits of your people, enhanced by the destructive power of flame that burns…

subEntries.title: Frost Giant Ancestry
subEntries.excerpt: As a goliath with Frost Giant ancestry, you possess the common traits of your people, enhanced by the freezing power of the mountains that…

subEntries.title: Hill Giant Ancestry
subEntries.excerpt: As a goliath with Hill Giant ancestry, you possess the common traits of your people, enhanced by the massive strength of the hills.

subEntries.title: Stone Giant Ancestry
subEntries.excerpt: As a goliath with Stone Giant ancestry, you possess the common traits of your people, enhanced by the endurance of the mountains.

subEntries.title: Storm Giant Ancestry
subEntries.excerpt: As a goliath with Storm Giant ancestry, you possess the common traits of your people, enhanced by the crackling power of the tempest.

title: Greenskins
excerpt: Greenskins are a diverse group of humanoids united by their orcish or goblinoid heritage. From the cunning goblins to the mighty orcs and half-orcs, they share a resilient nature and adaptability.

subEntries.title: Bugbear
subEntries.excerpt: Bugbears are the hulking cousins of goblins and hobgoblins.

subEntries.title: Goblin
subEntries.excerpt: Goblins are small humanoids with distant fey origins.

subEntries.title: Half-Orc
subEntries.excerpt: Half-orcs are individuals who carry the resilient and powerful heritage of orcs combined with the versatility of humans.

subEntries.title: Hobgoblin
subEntries.excerpt: Hobgoblins are disciplined and militant humanoids with a strong sense of hierarchy and honor.

subEntries.title: Orc
subEntries.excerpt: Orcs trace their creation to Gruumsh, a god who wandered the wild spaces of the Material Plane.

subEntries.title: Pathfinder Half-Orc
subEntries.excerpt: The Mark of Finding grants abilities related to locating people and objects.

subEntries.title: Verdan
subEntries.excerpt: The verdan are a people in transition.

title: Half-Elf
excerpt: Half-elves combine human versatility with elven grace. Those with specific elven heritage may inherit additional traits from their elven parent.

subEntries.title: Half-Elf (Aquatic)
subEntries.excerpt: Half-elves of aquatic elf heritage are rare, as aquatic elves seldom interact with surface-dwelling peoples.

subEntries.title: Half-Elf (Drow)
subEntries.excerpt: Half-elves of drow heritage are often the result of forbidden unions or raids upon the surface world.

subEntries.title: Half-Elf
subEntries.excerpt: Half-elves are individuals born from the union of humans and elves, or those who carry the heritage of both lineages in their blood.

subEntries.title: Half-Elf (High)
subEntries.excerpt: Half-elves with high elf heritage often display an affinity for the arcane arts that runs strong in their elven bloodline.

subEntries.title: Half-Elf (Seersight)
subEntries.excerpt: The Mark of Detection grants those who bear it powers of observation and insight.

subEntries.title: Half-Elf (Stormborn)
subEntries.excerpt: The Mark of Storm grants power over wind and weather.

subEntries.title: Half-Elf (Wood)
subEntries.excerpt: Half-elves with wood elf heritage inherit their elven parent's affinity for nature and their swift, graceful movements.

title: Halfling
excerpt: Halflings are small, cheerful folk known for their remarkable luck, bravery, and nimbleness. Each halfling subrace has adapted to different environments.

subEntries.title: Halfling
subEntries.excerpt: Halflings are a practical and lighthearted people who value home and community above all.

subEntries.title: Hearthkeeper Halfling
subEntries.excerpt: The Mark of Hospitality grants abilities related to food, shelter, and comfort.

subEntries.title: Lightfoot Halfling
subEntries.excerpt: As a lightfoot halfling, you can easily hide from notice, even using other people as cover.

subEntries.title: Lotusden Halfling
subEntries.excerpt: Lotusden halflings are native to the Lotusden Greenwood of Exandria, where they have developed a deep connection to the natural world and d…

subEntries.title: Mender Halfling
subEntries.excerpt: The Mark of Healing grants the ability to mend wounds and cure ailments.

subEntries.title: Stout Halfling
subEntries.excerpt: As a stout halfling, you're hardier than average and have some resistance to poison.

title: Human
excerpt: Humans are the most adaptable and ambitious people, known for their resourcefulness and determination. Some humans bear dragonmarks that grant mystical powers.

subEntries.title: Beastborn Human
subEntries.excerpt: The Mark of Handling grants the ability to calm and control animals.

subEntries.title: Forgeborn Human
subEntries.excerpt: The Mark of Making grants the ability to create and repair.

subEntries.title: Guardian Human
subEntries.excerpt: The Mark of Sentinel grants power to protect and defend.

subEntries.title: Human
subEntries.excerpt: Humans are the most ambitious and adaptable of the common races.

subEntries.title: Wayfarer Human
subEntries.excerpt: The Mark of Passage grants power over movement and transportation.

title: Planar Travelers
excerpt: Planar Travelers are beings with origins beyond the Material Plane or who possess unusual connections to other realms. They bring exotic abilities and unique perspectives.

subEntries.title: Kalashtar
subEntries.excerpt: The kalashtar are a compound people, created from the union of humanity and renegade spirits from the plane of dreams known as quori.

subEntries.title: Kender
subEntries.excerpt: Kender are small humanoids native to the world of Krynn, known for their insatiable curiosity, fearlessness, and tendency to 'find' things…

subEntries.title: Simic Hybrid
subEntries.excerpt: The Simic Combine uses a magical process to create hybrids of multiple organisms, sometimes including humans, elves, and vedalken.

subEntries.title: Triton
subEntries.excerpt: Originally from the Elemental Plane of Water, tritons serve as vigilant guardians across the world's oceans.

subEntries.title: Vedalken
subEntries.excerpt: Vedalken are tall, blue-skinned humanoids characterized by their relentless pursuit of knowledge and self-improvement.

title: Shapeshifters
excerpt: Shapeshifters are beings with the innate ability to alter their physical form. From the weretouched shifters to the amorphous plasmoids and identity-fluid changelings, they share a mutable nature that defies fixed shape.

subEntries.title: Beasthide Shifter
subEntries.excerpt: Beasthide shifters are typically tied to the bear or the boar, animals known for their tough hides and ferocious strength when cornered.

subEntries.title: Changeling
subEntries.excerpt: Changelings are masters of disguise, capable of supernaturally altering their appearance and voice.

subEntries.title: Longtooth Shifter
subEntries.excerpt: Longtooth shifters are fierce and aggressive, their lycanthropic heritage tied to fierce predators like wolves and tigers.

subEntries.title: Plasmoid
subEntries.excerpt: Plasmoids are amorphous beings of organic ooze who can alter their shape at will.

subEntries.title: Swiftstride Shifter
subEntries.excerpt: Swiftstride shifters are graceful and quick, their lycanthropic heritage tied to swift and elusive creatures like cats, rats, and ravens.

subEntries.title: Wildhunt Shifter
subEntries.excerpt: Wildhunt shifters are the most in tune with their animal nature, their lycanthropic heritage tied to creatures known for their keen senses…

title: Tiefling
excerpt: Tieflings carry the blood of the Lower Planes, manifesting fiendish traits. Each legacy reflects a different fiendish origin and grants unique magical abilities.

subEntries.title: Abyssal Legacy
subEntries.excerpt: Hailing from the chaos of the Abyss, this legacy grants resistance to poison and innate demonic magic.

subEntries.title: Chthonic Legacy
subEntries.excerpt: Linked to the gloom of Hades and Gehenna, this legacy grants resistance to necrotic energy and spectral magic.

subEntries.title: Infernal Legacy
subEntries.excerpt: The structured hierarchy of the Nine Hells is the source of the Infernal Legacy.
